message.content:
cs.CV, cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.MM

The paper deals with the development of a multimodal biometric recognition system using image and speech data to recognize twins from each other and from other people. This involves the use of computer vision techniques (such as Gabor filter) for ear identification and speech recognition algorithms (such as MFCC and DTW). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves the use of machine learning techniques for recognition, which could fall under sub-categories such as cs.SD (Sound and Music Computing), cs.CL (Computation and Language), and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper deals with the development of a multi-biometrics system, which could fall under cs.MM (Multimedia).
